meanings.definition: A quantity of medicine taken or prescribed at one time.
meanings.sent1: After feeling unwell, she took a small dosed of medicine.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed a dosed of cough syrup for the patient.
meanings.sent3: The dosed of medicine tasted surprisingly good.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like a dosed of happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The dosed of medicine was carefully measured to ensure effectiveness.

meanings.definition: To administer a dose of medicine to.
meanings.sent1: The nurse dosed the patient with the prescribed medicine.
meanings.sent2: He carefully dosed out the medication to each individual.
meanings.sent3: She playfully dosed her friend with a pretend potion.
meanings.sent4: The chef dosed the soup with just the right amount of seasoning.
meanings.sent5: The gardener dosed the plants with fertilizer to help them grow.

meanings.definition: To treat with a dose of medicine.
meanings.sent1: The doctor dosed the patient to alleviate the symptoms.
meanings.sent2: She dosed her pet with the prescribed medication.
meanings.sent3: He dosed himself with the remedy to feel better.
meanings.sent4: The pharmacist dosed the medicine according to the prescription.
meanings.sent5: The mother dosed her child with the cough syrup before bedtime.
